page.title: 10Seabrook's Crisp Factory
page.content: The{Seabrook factory}is situated in an old village called Allerton, on the outskirts of Bradford. The factory is on a main road which is a steep hill. The{workers}wear overalls and hats for hygene purposes.{Women}work on the production line while the{men}are managers and mechanics. The{potatoes}used have to be round and most of them come from down south. They use three quarters of a ton of potatoes a day. First, the potatoes are washed, then peeled, cut, straight or crinkle then blanched. They are dried then fried in cotton seed oil. {Flavouring}is added and the crisps are put into packets and these are packed into boxes. These are distributed east and west. The factory is noisy and smelly causing the neighbours to complain.
